author: minaminao
content:
I found that OpenEthereum's txpool uses B trees, which are as fast as (and in some cases faster than) SBSTs. BTW, there is no SBST in Rust's standard library, and B trees are often used instead of SBSTs.
https://github.com/paritytech/parity-common/blob/master/transaction-pool/src/pool.rs#L53
I don't know why the txpool need two B trees: `best_transactions` and `worst_transactions`.

author: minaminao
content: I think a single B tree would be sufficient, because it can take both most profitable and least profitable transactions.

author: lightclient
content: <@!370136219927052298> an interesting thing to note is that the go-ethereum mempool uses a min heap, so it is already assumed that miners will resort their txs each block to build the most profitable list

author: minaminao
content: Interesting. I guess OpenEthereum doesn't sort each block since it uses B trees. On the other hand, Geth sorts each block.
